Description: Wheel-made pottery lamp with a flattened double-convex body, an unpierced lug on the left side, and a short flat-topped nozzle, broken at the wick-hole. The filling-hole is surrounded by a bead rim and groove. The wide raised base is concave below. Decorated with a black slip.
Excavator/field collector: Field Collection by: Sir Charles Thomas Newton
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ.(?) (?)
Curator's comments: Parallel from Eretria (Bailey 1977, 190). Early 3rd century BC parallels from Alexandria (Blondé 1998, 324, nos. 18, 20). Blondé, F. 1998. Lampes tournée Hellénistiques du Musée D’Alexandrie, in Empereur, J-Y. (ed.), Commerce et Artisant dans l’Alexandrie Hellénistique et Romaine, Paris, 307-35.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q439)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KC.46) (Phase 1)
